definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
marriage arranged following a pregnancy/marriage necessitated by an unplanned pregnancy

sentences.english: My friend announced her shotgun wedding this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上我的朋友宣佈她要奉子成婚。

sentences.english: After their marriage in 1855, Samuel moved into the James home.
sentences.chinese: 1855年兩人成婚後，薩謬搬進了詹家。

sentences.english: When a couple gets married, the bride's family usually pays for the reception.
sentences.chinese: 夫妻成婚時，新娘家凡是支付宴會費用。

sentences.english: He admitted he had been married before but said he divorced and married Lam in June.
sentences.chinese: 他坦言自己結過婚但已離婚，並於六月與林嘉欣成婚。

sentences.english: It might lead to a shotgun wedding.
I tried on several wedding dresses that had this type of inside support to hold up strapless dresses.
sentences.chinese: 自己試穿過幾件這類從內部支撐樣式地成婚號衣。

sentences.english: “Being single” only means the lack of a marriage or dating partner.
sentences.chinese: “成爲單身”僅僅意味着尚未成婚或者沒有戀人。

sentences.english: The parson official1y pronounced that they became one。
sentences.chinese: 牧師正式宣告他們成婚。

sentences.english: The Tan Song prefer to have inherited a wreck and Tracy married.
sentences.chinese: 而儺送寧肯繼承一條破船也要與翠翠成婚。

sentences.english: Cheng bite gold in flower bigfoot under persecution finally with the couple.
sentences.chinese: 程咬金在花大腳的逼迫之下終於跟其成婚。

sentences.english: It's a real shotgun wedding for these two.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個人是真正的奉子成婚。

sentences.english: she likes mike a lot, but she doesn't want to get married so early.
sentences.chinese: 她很喜歡邁克，可是她不想恁地早成婚。

sentences.english: It looks like it's a shotgun marriage for those two.
sentences.chinese: 看上去這兩個人好像是奉子成婚。

sentences.english: They got married with the blessing of their parents and all their friends.
sentences.chinese: 他們在父母和所有朋友的祝福聲中成婚。

sentences.english: And people were so immodest as to marry in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 人們不因在家中成婚而害臊。

sentences.english: I’ve heard that they had a shotgun wedding.

definition: (of a groom) to escort the bride to the wedding ceremony/fig. to take as one's wife/to marry
to take a wife/to get married (man)
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
variant of 訂婚|订婚[ding4 hun1]
(of a child bride) to consummate marriage
to tie the knot (idiom)/to get married
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
